title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, seen through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his quixotic passion for Daisy Buchanan.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of Elizabeth Bennet.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about teenage rebellion and angst as told by Holden Caulfield.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy adventure of Frodo Baggins on his journey to destroy the One Ring.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A prelude to the Lord of the Rings, following Bilbo Baggins on a quest with dwarves.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The tale of the obsessive quest of Captain Ahab for revenge on Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping novel that captures the history and humanity of Russia during the Napoleonic era.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic following Odysseus's journey home after the Trojan War.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A story of a young man in St. Petersburg whose mental anguish leads him to murder.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic society controlled by technology and conditioning, where happiness is enforced.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: An orphan's journey to independence and love in Victorian England.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A dark romance of love, revenge, and tragedy on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A story of scientific ambition and the unintended consequences of creating life.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: The story of Pip, a young orphan who seeks wealth and respect but finds meaning in humility.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A tragic romance that explores the complexities of love, marriage, and society.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A young man's obsession with youth and beauty leads him down a dark path.

title: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
description: A story of a woman's search for happiness beyond the mundane constraints of provincial life.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel that delves into the moral and spiritual dilemmas of family and faith.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
description: A magical realist tale of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The iconic story of Count Dracula's attempt to spread the undead curse in England.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem that describes Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

title: Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: A satirical novel about the absurdity of war and bureaucratic nonsense.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A story of redemption and sacrifice set against the backdrop of post-revolutionary France.
